meanings.definition: To coat or cover with a patina.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys patinating her sculptures to give them a unique look.
meanings.sent2: The artist is patinating the metal surface to create an antique finish.
meanings.sent3: The students had fun patinating their art projects with colorful paints.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to be patinating the old building, adding character to its facade.
meanings.sent5: The sun's rays patinating the leaves with a golden hue made the forest glow.

meanings.definition: To undergo a chemical change that results in the formation of a patina.
meanings.sent1: Over time, the copper pot will start patinating, developing a greenish tint.
meanings.sent2: The bronze statue is slowly patinating due to exposure to the elements.
meanings.sent3: The experiment showed how metals can patinate when exposed to certain chemicals.
meanings.sent4: The old coins were patinating in the damp cellar, turning them a dull color.
meanings.sent5: The metal gate was patinating beautifully, showcasing nature's artistic touch.
